Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 4295(derived from DNA-polymerase domain of HIV-1 RT (20-mers))
Sequence Information.Source: Synthetic construct(derived from HIV-1 Reverse Transcriptase)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.15790559]HIV-1:the level of peptide binding to HIV integrase is low.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: Two viral encoded enzymes(reverse transcriptase and integrase) play central roles in the early stages of the replication of retroviruses and retrotransposons.The peptide derived from the RT DNA polymerase domain inhibits all three integrase-associated activities (3â€²-end processing, strand transfer, and disintegration) and inhibit virus replication.

Literature.Title: Peptides derived from the reverse transcriptase of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 as novel inhibitors of the viral integrase.
Literature.Author: Oz Gleenberg I, Avidan O, Goldgur Y, Herschhorn A, Hizi A.
